revised_title: Neutron Scattering in Incommensurate Structures: Displacive Instabilities and Soft Mode Theories
tldr: This article reviews recent neutron scattering studies of incommensurate structures and their displacive phase transformations. It discusses the concept of soft phonons and their role in instabilities within periodic crystalline structures. The article also explores the behavior of charge density waves and phonon softening in quasi-one-dimensional and quasi-two-dimensional metals, as well as in insulators.
